title: Social Media Manager - Assistant (Volunteer) Job at Powered By Health Initiative
content:
Powered By Health Initiative (PBHI) is a global organization focused on advancing health equity and social justice by empowering vulnerable communities. We provide integrated healthcare services, advocate for policy reforms, and address the social determinants of health. PBHI works to eliminate barriers to healthcare, promote gender equality, and create economic opportunities, ensuring that every individual has access to quality care and the resources to thrive. Our mission is to foster lasting change through community-driven solutions and systemic advocacy, making healthcare a universal right for all.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Manager - Assistant (Volunteer)
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Nigeria
Slot: 2 Openings

Job Description


	This role is designed for individuals who can blend creativity with strategy, understand social algorithms, manage data-driven schedules, and maintain real-time responsiveness across multiple platforms.


Key Responsibilities


	Co-manage daily operations of PBHI’s social media platforms (Instagram, X/Twitter, LinkedIn, TikTok)
	Build and maintain platform-specific content calendars aligned with our editorial vision
	Analyse engagement metrics weekly and propose actionable insights
	Support execution of global campaigns and awareness days
	Maintain brand consistency in captions, tone, visuals, and responses
	Engage actively with followers, partner platforms, and collaborators
	Innovate automation and scheduling systems using tools like Buffer, Notion, Metricool, etc.


Requirements


	Minimum 1 year of professional, volunteer, or academic experience related to public health or digital engagement
	Demonstrated experience managing public-facing accounts for a health, development, or advocacy brand
	Ability to interpret analytics and translate numbers into strategy
	High responsiveness and commitment to daily time blocks
	Fluency in visual storytelling and platform algorithms
	Proficiency with tools like Meta Suite, Canva, Notion, and Buffer
	Fluency in English (spoken and written); multilingual abilities are a plus
	Willingness to adhere to PBHI’s volunteer performance framework, code of conduct, and weekly task expectations
	Consistent access to a personal computer and reliable internet
	Proven ability to work independently in a structured, remote, and cross-cultural team.

title: Operations Manager - Art Gallery Job at West Africa Vocational Education (WAVE)
content:
WAVE is solving what is arguably the biggest challenge on the continent: youth unemployment. In West Africa, 40-85% of youth, more than 50 million, are either unemployed or underemployed. Meanwhile, job creation in the region is on the rise. The disconnect between work-ready youth and the employment market must be bridged.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Manager - Art Gallery

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Job
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a dynamic and highly motivated Art Gallery Operations Manager with strong connections to High net-worth individuals (HNIs).
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing gallery operations, hosting and networking with HNIs, organizing exhibitions, and driving art sales.
	This role requires a high-agency individual with excellent people management skills and a proven track record in achieving business objectives.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage day-to-day operations of the art gallery, ensuring smooth functioning.
	Host, interact, and build strong relationships with HNIs to promote the gallery and its exhibitions.
	Collaborate in planning, organizing, and executing art exhibitions and events that attract and engage HNIs.
	Lead and manage gallery staff, providing guidance and ensuring alignment with gallery goals.
	Network extensively to bring new HNIs and collectors to the gallery.
	Collaborate with artists, curators, and other stakeholders to curate compelling exhibitions.
	Monitor sales performance and provide regular reports to senior management.
	Maintain high standards of customer service and gallery presentation.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree.
	Proven access to and experience working with high net-worth individuals.
	Strong networking and interpersonal skills.
	Demonstrated ability to manage people and meet business objectives.
	Experience in art gallery operations, sales, or a related field is advantageous.
	Excellent organizational and communication skills.
	High level of professionalism and discretion.
	Ability to work independently and take initiative.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitments@waveacademies.org using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Supply Chain Analyst Job at Workforce Group
content:
Workforce group is a leading provider of end-to-end, integrated and result focused Business and Human Resource solutions in Nigeria. From inception in 2004, we have helped clients across diverse industries and sectors such as Financial Services, Telecoms, Oil and Gas, Real Estate, Hospitality, Power, Entertainment, FMCG, etc., to achieve their strategic goals and objectives.

Workforce Group is a top business and HR consulting firm in Nigeria, offering advisory, outsourcing, recruitment and assessment, learning and development, market entry and technology services and solutions. Our reputation for excellence in service was built from over a decade of providing business and human resource consulting across several states in Nigeria.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Supply Chain Analyst 
Job Location: Lagos
Reports to: Warehouse Manager

Job Summary


	We are hiring a Supply Chain Analyst for a client in the renewable energy sector. 
	The ideal candidate will support supply chain operations, coordinate shipping and freight, ensure timely cargo clearance, and drive efficiency through data analysis and inventory control.


Job Responsibilities


	Daily reporting and tracking of all company shipments from origin to the warehouse.
	Assess clearing agents’ operations and compliance with the organisation's policy.
	Analyze supply chain data to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
	Reconcile and process all agents’ payment invoices with the Finance team.
	Inventory control using ERP to prevent month-on-month inventory variances in the assigned hub.
	Track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to assess supply chain performance and identify areas for cost optimization.
	Ensure 100% documentation and records relating to the organisation's supply chain.
	Oversee inbound operations after cargo delivery by HSE compliance.
	Work cross-functionally with inventory lead on warehouse storage and inventory levels.


Requirements and skills


	B.Sc / HND in any related field.
	1–2 years of experience in supply chain operations, business analysis, or a similar role.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel is critical.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Detail-oriented with the ability to handle multiple tasks and prioritize effectively in a fast-paced environment.
	Collaborative team player able to work cross-functionally and build relationships with stakeholders.
	Excellent communication skills.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy.


Key Requirements:


	B.Sc/HND in a relevant field
	Minimum of 1 year of supply chain or similar experience
	Strong Excel and analytical skills
	Detail-oriented, organized, and a good team player.


Salary
N150,000 net + HMO & Pension.

title: Business Development Officer Job at Petrogap Oil and Gas Limited
content:
Petrogap Oil and Gas Limited was incorporated as a response to the emerging trends in the dynamic Oil & Gas industry. We are a wholly indigenous company and registered player in the Upstream, Midstream and Downstream sectors of the Oil & Gas industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Assist in developing a sustainable business relationship model for new and existing Clients such as IOCs, DPR, NAPIMS, NNPC and other regulatory body in the oil and gas industry
	Prepare projects technical and commercial pre-qualifications proposal/bid to the Clients.
	Facilitate or assist as required in the strategy development and actual negotiation (technical, commercial and contractual) with customers and suppliers.
	Work closely with Clients to identify prospective projects needs for technical and commercial implementation
	Assist in sourcing, packaging, bidding on various platforms (within the stipulated deadline) and ensuring that all bids are won and executed flawlessly.
	Develop and maintain a complete understanding of the business environment, market trends, drivers and issues that will impact on the Company's business.
	Source for Clients future projects with In -depth knowledge of up-coming and on-going key projects and follow-up till business is generated and awarded
	Reactivate dormant Client account and relationship to generate tangible business.


Qualification / Person Specification


	 Interested candidates should possess a B.Sc Degree with 1 - 3 years of working as a Business Development Officer in the Oil and Gas industry.
	Age range: 23 - 35 years old.
	Sex: Male or Female.


Requirements:


	In-depth knowledge of up-coming and on-going key projects in the upstream sector of the Oil and Gas Sector.
	Engaged in robust and high level contacts in the IOCs and E&P companies.
	Experience in Upstream Business Development.
	Candidates should have strong links to industry and knowledge of the business drivers for the key markets.
	Strong financial acumen and analytical skills.
	Strong networking and interpersonal skills.
	Excellent relationship management skills.
	Excellent intelligence gathering skills.
	Leadership qualities.
	Proficient in advanced Excel and Powerpoint.


Benefits
Competitive salary with monthly Bonus on transactions.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers.pgog@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
